title: Alignment key (SLASH'EM)
data:
| (   The Key of Chaos/Neutrality/Law   [![Skeleton key.png](/images/e/ec/Skeleton_key.png)](/wiki/File:Skeleton_key.png) |                                                                                                                                                                              |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                                                                                                               | [skeleton key](/wiki/Skeleton_key "Skeleton key")                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Affiliation                                                                                                             | - [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")/[neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")/[lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful")
- [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent_artifacts "Intelligent artifacts") |
|                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                              |
| When carried                                                                                                            | *(none)*                                                                                                                                                                     |
| When applied                                                                                                            | Can open respective doors in [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower")                                                                                             |
| When invoked                                                                                                            | *(none)*                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Base price                                                                                                              | 1000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                                                                                                           |
| Weight                                                                                                                  | [3](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                                                                                   |

The **alignment keys** are three [artifacts](/wiki/Artifacts "Artifacts") that appear in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). Each key - the **Key of Law**, **Key of Neutrality** and **Key of Chaos** - is [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent "Intelligent"), and their [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [skeleton key](/wiki/Skeleton_key "Skeleton key").

## Generation

Each of the alignment keys can only be found in the possession of each [alignment quest](/wiki/Alignment_quest "Alignment quest") nemesis: [Nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightmare (SLASH'EM)") in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest"), [Beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Beholder (SLASH'EM)") in the [Neutral Quest](/wiki/Neutral_Quest "Neutral Quest"), and [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna") in the [Chaotic Quest](/wiki/Chaotic_Quest "Chaotic Quest"). As they are guaranteed to appear in every game, they cannot be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for.

## Description

The purpose of the alignment keys is to open the central six doors at the top level of [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower"), which have been made indestructible: any two of the three keys can be used for this purpose, though there are also [methods to circumvent the doors](/wiki/Alignment_quest#SLASH.27EM "Alignment quest").

Unlike other artifacts that are 'required' to access the invocation items and win the games, the alignment keys can be put into containers - if a container is destroyed with an alignment key inside, it is lost forever; the game will often throw a "indestructible object free" error message. If more than one of the keys is destroyed this way and the doors on Vlad's tower are not yet unlocked, winning the game requires the player to use one of the alternate strategies to wake up Vlad.

## Strategy

Outside of access to Vlad, the alignment keys can also be used as permanent unlocking tools, since SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM make it possible for standard unlocking tools to break - a character can keep the key of their own alignment around in their open inventory for this purpose, since the other artifact keys will [blast](/wiki/Artifact_blast "Artifact blast") them.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Alignment key (SLASH'EM)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
(   The Key of Chaos/Neutrality/Law  
Base item skeleton key
Affiliation
  • chaotic/neutral/lawful
  • intelligent
When carried (none)
When applied Can open respective doors in Vlad's Tower
When invoked (none)
Base price 1000 zm
Weight 3

The alignment keys are three artifacts that appear in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM. Each key - the Key of Law, Key of Neutrality and Key of Chaos - is intelligent, and their base item is a skeleton key.

Generation

Each of the alignment keys can only be found in the possession of each alignment quest nemesis: Nightmare in the Lawful Quest, Beholder in the Neutral Quest, and Vecna in the Chaotic Quest. As they are guaranteed to appear in every game, they cannot be wished for.

Description

The purpose of the alignment keys is to open the central six doors at the top level of Vlad's Tower, which have been made indestructible: any two of the three keys can be used for this purpose, though there are also methods to circumvent the doors.

Unlike other artifacts that are 'required' to access the invocation items and win the games, the alignment keys can be put into containers - if a container is destroyed with an alignment key inside, it is lost forever; the game will often throw a "indestructible object free" error message. If more than one of the keys is destroyed this way and the doors on Vlad's tower are not yet unlocked, winning the game requires the player to use one of the alternate strategies to wake up Vlad.

Strategy

Outside of access to Vlad, the alignment keys can also be used as permanent unlocking tools, since SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM make it possible for standard unlocking tools to break - a character can keep the key of their own alignment around in their open inventory for this purpose, since the other artifact keys will blast them.
